Today I publish a rather simple #Space #Science with #Python video on "Sample Weights".

Our Cassini CDA Calibration fit from last time did not consider the input data distribution. In fact, mostly people don't do that when conducting regression tasks. But ... well ... you should (either by over- / under-sampling, or sample weights).

Our case is too simple for that (in fact). But it is best practice nonetheless #ml #ai #keras #coding #programming

https://youtu.be/x6kDzp1thHo

title: No Mow May? No Mow April? Low Mow Spring?

last_post.content:
If you have a lawn, and would like it to help #bees, there are a few things you can do less. Don't use pesticides. Don't use herbicides. Don't mow for the first few weeks when the grass begins to grow. This will allow wildflowers such as clover, violets, and self-heal to feed #pollinators. In England, and many parts of the US, this time is May. So this practice is commonly known as #NoMowMay.

Watch this and learn much more about No Mow May:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ihXAwIcBoJ4

One of the topics this summer in our #CulturalHeritage Centre will be natural #cordage, #fibres from nature and the old #traditions of these plants: #brambles, #nettles, #hemp or #linen. Summer is a good time because most of the #plants are strong enough. As a guide, I'm diving into youtube because you can find many (good and bad) tutorials. Like this one: Making #strings from #nettles https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0grnnvmpn1A #wildcraft #nature #handcraft #craft #ReconnectingWithNature

https://youtu.be/KRT-tIn9yeE

@ClaireFromClare @natureworks There are different regional traditions and materials but the #skep #hives are quite common in many countries. My photo is from our Alsatian farm museum and #CulturalHeritage centre. Here is a skep maker in GB showing the technique: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vLITXe_xvM8
The shape developed with experience. The bees liked it, it was weather protected. The hook shows that this one was suspended under the barn/house eaves. People lived with their #bees very close.

I’m just so proud of the messages from the national 4-H organization about diversity and inclusion. It honestly got me a bit tearful tonight.

As a closeted gay youth in a rural area, I didn’t have many chances to experience diversity of any kind. I felt alone.

4-H gave me the chance to travel, see the world is much bigger than I imagined, and taught me there is a place for everyone. I’m forever thankful. 🌈🍀❤️

title: Everyday wisdom from Wired magazine's founding editor

last_post.content: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wXML1wXlVmI #gaming #advice #mmo #kevinkelly

If you went to Carnegie-Mellon in the late 1980s, you probably took a Pascal course, like 15-111, that was taught with the #Pascal Genie, a "structured editor" that allowed programmers to write syntactically valid Pascal programs without worrying about questions like "Did I forget a semicolon?" Older folks used the #VAX 11/780 version, younger folks used it on a Mac.

I managed to find a copy of it to run in emulation, and walk through it in this video, while writing a program that would absolutely get an F from Phil Miller and Mark Stehlik. Please check it out and share with people you think might be interested

https://youtu.be/FXx1JGibSz4

I'm a bit nervous posting this since both @psu_13 and @kvd worked on the Genie and I probably made 50 mistakes in this video that they will be able to correct.

#retro #retrocomputing #programming

A friend texted me from a Sleaford Mods show. Unfamiliar with em, I dialed up the first suggestion from Apple Music, and immediately recognized the vocalist as the same one from this recent Orbital single: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4FM7XeaSO0M (A collaboration, turns out.)

Because it’s Orbital, I had assumed the vocals were just a sample from some obscure UK film!

Gotta be one of the most distinctive voices in #ElectronicMusic today, if I can speak in the most literal sense of “distinctive voice”.

#Music

title: Torque Social Hour: How Young People Can Get Involved With WordPress

last_post.content:
Does #WordPress community have trouble reaching younger users? On this today's livestream we'll be talking with Olivia Bisset about getting young people involved in WordPress and Computer Science. Olivia is a young entrepreneur who has been organizing hackathons since her early teens.

Our special co-host is @michelebutcherjones, who has also been involved in bringing more people into the WordPress project.

Watch the livestream from 3-4pm Pacific today here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TbC9YWNmEac

title: Resisting Dystopia  |  Becky Chambers & Annalee Newitz

last_post.content:
Such a lovely and hope-inspiring conversation between two great authors, Becky Chambers and @annaleen. Together, they discuss the false binaries of utopia and dystopia, while finding the cozy in between - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XI6qAIJbjs0 #writing #scifi #scienceFiction #dune #terraformers #monkAndRobot

Fav line alluding to Paul Atreides (paraphrased) : "If saving the future was just a matter of a 'chosen' white guy taking drugs, we'd be done already."

"I've been getting into synthesizers a lot. Can I play you something?"

https://youtu.be/87o1aIsVEKM

"It’s a well-established fact that when Eddie Van Halen first proposed Jump for Van Halen, as early as 1981, it was vetoed as beyond the ken of the band’s established and growing rock fanbase, so how did it ever end up being released?"

https://www.musicradar.com/news/van-halen-jump-synth-first-recording

#music #history #VanHalen #jump

title: 1 Million Members, 100 Million Trees: How Brazil’s Socialist Farmers Are Fighting Big Ag

last_post.content:
Municipal nurseries can be a huge driver of social and political change. The Landless Workers Movement in Brazil are doing agroecological projects by making collective nurseries to help revive the native ecosystem and organize the working class.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KiXkUPeMx9I

They are an intersectional ecosocialist movement with Black and Indigenous people leading the fight against agro-businesses and the capitalist class that exploits the people and the ecosystem. They also do land occupations to take back land for the people. Deforestation is a major issue in Brazil, this is done almost exclusively by corporations and wealthy land owners who only see the land as a profit machine, and not a delicate ecosystem that can be managed in responsible ways borrowing from the experience of the local people. We could learn a lot from movements like this, and tailor tactics and methods to our bioregions and communities. By learning methods from agroecology, permaculture, and indigenous communities we can figure out better ways to sustain the ecosystem and each other.

Land occupations and squats to build ecosocialist - intersectional - and communal life while repairing the ecosystem with native biodiversity is amazing. Giving land back to indigenous people, and the working class to steward the land is a worthy fight.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1sZ0FMJqefw

#solarpunk #ecosocialism

Want to understand how cartoonists’ work made its way from their drawing board to a newspaper page from roughly the 1910s to 1980s? https://youtu.be/-TBrV4-LpnA My video explains it all with historical footage and artifacts*

*A similar process was used with fewer steps and more casting of metal plates from the 1890s to 1910s

(1/3) "Making Mistakes" (Osiris), preprint: https://osf.io/s7nre -- what a United stock price drop, a Google Grindr recommendation, and student facial detection tell us about the politics of failed sociotechnical systems

(2/3) "Seeing Like an Algorithmic Error" -- how far is an institution willing to go to fix a racist algorithmic facial detection system?

a) Paper (Yale Journal of Law and Technology): https://law.yale.edu/sites/default/files/area/center/isp/documents/ananny.pdf

b) Talk (University of Ottawa): https://youtu.be/uQ0gC4QJ4pg

Today is the day we (maybe) go to space. The launch window for the integrated flight test of the #SpaceX #Starship opens at 07:00 CDT (12:00 UTC) today. Lift off from the SpaceX Starbase in Texas, with reentry and splashdown near Hawaii. #Booster7 #Ship24 Live coverage by SpaceX itself, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L5QXreqOrTA, and commentary and live coverage from the folks at NASASpaceflight at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eN57x2a_waw.

Bowsette, this song, and some of the ace content generated around both have become a big part of trans femme culture. It's worth exploring. You won't regret it.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=euMVNE8tWjQ&list=PL0O40c1c5Xt0SXzuRoDloW0MgA8Zxm65M&index=3

#geoweirdness

We haven't done much with #Bicycling #Monterey's YouTube channel—mostly because we provide bikemonterey.org and all bike advocacy projects to date (May 2009-April 2023) as a volunteer and simply can't do more tasks; and partly because #YouTube is a Google company.

Nonetheless, we posted our new video on YouTube this week "ANDAR EN BICICLETA EN LAS ACERAS además de ejemplos de ordenanzas del Condado de Monterey, California," including transcript/subtitles.

That motivated us to type up subtitles for 2 short #videos we'd previously posted on our channel: "BikeMonterey.org - Sea Otter Classic, a Celebration of Cycling - Detox!" and "BikeMonterey.org - HER Helmet Thursdays welcome from Alvarado St, Monterey."

We truly appreciate those (even bots) for reminding of importance of #subtitles, photo #descriptions, #AltText, etc. Just wish for more hours in the day to provide them, including time required to write better #PhotoDescriptions.

#DoWhatYouCan #BikeTooter

https://youtu.be/pkH8V3hFlns

For those of you that don't own a house yet, here's one thing that you may not realize: lawn maintenance and upkeep is a constant time-consuming task. If your house is in a neighborhood with an HOA (which is almost all of them nowadays), it's also a task you cannot ignore. Your options are to do it yourself (time-consuming) or pay others to do it (expensive). If you don't do it and run afoul of your HOA, you can find yourself drowning in fees and fines and possibly even lose your house. Lawn upkeep is just one of the ways one can arouse the ire of the HOA.

John Oliver's latest Last Week Tonight highlighted the lunacy that is HOAs in the US.

Edit: I'm hearing that the video is US-only, so you might have to find it elsewhere. It should be available on HBO Max, if you have that.

https://youtu.be/qrizmAo17Os

She played her demo tape in her taxi when she gave a ride to director Jonathan Demme.
